about.name: Portland
about.info_text: Portland, often referred to as the 'City of Roses,' is a diverse and eco-conscious city located in the Pacific Northwest of the United States. Known for its beautiful landscapes, vibrant arts scene, and unique culture, Portland offers a wide range of experiences for residents and visitors. The city is famous for its lush green spaces, craft beer, coffee shops, and a strong commitment to sustainability and eco-friendliness. Whether you're exploring the outdoors, enjoying local cuisine, or immersing yourself in the city's arts and music, Portland has something for everyone.
about.facts_text:
Population: Approximately 653,000
State: Oregon
Time Zone: Pacific Time Zone (UTC-08:00)
Language: English
Currency: United States Dollar (USD)
about.climate_text: Portland experiences a mild, oceanic climate with distinct seasons. Summers are typically warm and dry, while winters are cool and rainy. The city's green surroundings remain lush throughout the year.

attractions_card.title: Powell's City of Books
attractions_card.description: Powell's City of Books is a renowned independent bookstore and one of the world's largest new and used bookstores, with a vast collection of books across multiple floors.

attractions_card.title: Washington Park
attractions_card.description: Washington Park is a sprawling urban park that includes the International Rose Test Garden, the Oregon Zoo, and the Portland Japanese Garden, offering a blend of natural beauty and cultural experiences.

attractions_card.title: Pioneer Courthouse Square
attractions_card.description: Pioneer Courthouse Square, often called 'Portland's Living Room,' is a central gathering place for events, concerts, and cultural celebrations in the heart of the city.

attractions_card.title: Portland Art Museum
attractions_card.description: The Portland Art Museum features an extensive collection of art, including American, European, and Native American works, making it a hub for artistic and cultural exploration.

attractions_card.title: Portland Saturday Market
attractions_card.description: The Portland Saturday Market is an outdoor arts and crafts market showcasing a wide array of handmade products, local art, and international cuisine.

attractions_card.title: Lan Su Chinese Garden
attractions_card.description: Lan Su Chinese Garden is a tranquil oasis in the heart of the city, designed in the style of a classical Chinese garden, with peaceful ponds, pavilions, and cultural events.

attractions_card.title: Forest Park
attractions_card.description: Forest Park is one of the largest urban forests in the United States, offering miles of hiking and biking trails, a diverse range of wildlife, and scenic views.

attractions_card.alt: Oregon Museum of Science and Industry (OMSI)
attractions_card.title: Oregon Museum of Science and Industry (OMSI)
attractions_card.description: OMSI is a hands-on science museum with interactive exhibits, a planetarium, and an OMNIMAX theater, making it a great educational destination for all ages.

food_card.title: Food Trucks
food_card.description: Portland is famous for its diverse and creative food truck scene, offering a wide variety of international cuisines and gourmet dishes.

food_card.title: Voodoo Doughnut
food_card.description: Voodoo Doughnut is an iconic doughnut shop known for its unique and creative doughnut flavors, including the famous Voodoo Doll doughnut.

food_card.title: Farm-to-Table Dining
food_card.description: Portland's farm-to-table restaurants emphasize locally sourced and seasonal ingredients, providing fresh and sustainable dining experiences.

food_card.title: Craft Beer
food_card.description: Portland is often called 'Beervana' due to its thriving craft beer scene, with numerous breweries and pubs offering a wide selection of local and regional beers.

food_card.title: Coffee Culture
food_card.description: Portland is known for its vibrant coffee culture, with a plethora of coffee shops and roasteries serving high-quality brews.

hotels_card.alt: The Nines, a Luxury Collection Hotel
hotels_card.title: The Nines, a Luxury Collection Hotel
hotels_card.description: The Nines is a luxury hotel located in the heart of downtown Portland, known for its stylish rooms and top-notch amenities.

hotels_card.title: Heathman Hotel
hotels_card.description: The Heathman Hotel is a historic and elegant hotel in downtown Portland, offering classic charm and modern comforts.

hotels_card.title: The Benson, a Coast Hotel
hotels_card.description: The Benson is a timeless and sophisticated hotel with a rich history, providing impeccable service and a central location.

hotels_card.title: Hotel Monaco Portland
hotels_card.description: Hotel Monaco is a boutique hotel known for its quirky design, vibrant colors, and playful atmosphere.

hotels_card.title: The Jupiter Hotel
hotels_card.description: The Jupiter Hotel offers a unique and artsy experience, with retro-style rooms and a lively urban vibe.

transport_card.title: TriMet (Public Transit)
transport_card.description: TriMet operates the public transit system in Portland, including buses, MAX light rail, and streetcars, providing convenient transportation throughout the city.

transport_card.title: Biking
transport_card.description: Portland is known for its bike-friendly infrastructure, with numerous bike lanes and bike-sharing programs for eco-friendly transportation.

transport_card.title: Portland International Airport (PDX)
transport_card.description: Portland International Airport is the primary airport serving the city, offering domestic and international flights with a focus on sustainability.

transport_card.title: Rental Cars
transport_card.description: Rental car services are available at the airport and throughout the city for those who prefer the flexibility of driving.
